author: ajsutton
content:
You'd typically only be issuing block by range requests while syncing in which case you don't want to be connected to a light client which is useless, but the light client doesn't want to be connected to you either so it works out.
Block by hash is a little more ambiguous but you can't really expect a peer to send you a block by hash if it hasn't somehow advertised that it actually has that block.

author: ajsutton
content: The most likely reason I'd expect light clients to find it hard to keep peers is that a full node, particularly a validating one, would likely be prioritising peers that are subscribed to attestation subnets. Non-validating nodes don't have that requirement though and would probably be enough to support light clients well. Might take a little bit of rejigging peer prioritisation rules but shouldn't be too bad.
